0.1.name: wordpress/auto-future-date
0.1.description:
Make it easier on yourself to schedule future posts.

Auto Future Date allows you to quickly and easily schedule posts based on the last post on your site. A simple click on a link and your post will be scheduled for a future date based on a set of simple rules that you set up.

I use this on a blog of mine where I write several posts at a time and want to spread them out rather than publishing them all at the same time. Future posts are great for this, but I found myself going back and forth to the calendar to schedule.

When activated the plugin adds an "Auto" link right next to the link that you use to schedule a future post. Clicking on the Auto link makes an Ajax call that will set the date for your post at some point in the future, using rules that you set.

More information at Nutt.net
